basics.name: Peter Taylor
basics.label: ICT Manager at WildBear Entertainment
basics.summary:
IT Manager with experience working in Education, Entertainment, Law, Oil & Gas and Governmental organisations. I have worked within an Active Directory domain as well as experience with Exchange, document management systems, time management software plus many different helpdesk systems. My experience so far has been a mix of on-site and remote assistance with users at home and abroad.

Specialties: Telephone manner, remote diagnostics, call recording, logical diagnosis, networking, Spiceworks administration

work.name: Self-Employed
work.summary: Writing reviews for the latest releases for the gaming section of The Digital Fix (https://www.thedigitalfix.com/), Digital Chumps (https://digitalchumps.com) and Jump Dash Roll (https://www.jumpdashroll.com). Specific formats I review for are currently PC, XBox and Switch. These reviews are written in my spare time and requires an ability to critically asses game titles and commit these thoughts in a clear and concise manner.

work.name: Marist College Canberra
work.summary: Acting as first point of contact and providing wide-ranging technical support at all levels for all users (approx. 2000) and systems in the college as required, including network administration, server administration and school-wide hardware.

work.name: Dalet Digital Media Systems
work.summary: Working at Prime7 Canberra I supported the news editorial staff in their use of Dalet's Media Asset Management software. This included supporting newsroom staff during recordings as well as during pre-news hours compiling the days clips and media.

work.name: GPET
work.summary:
First point of contact for all user IT issues
Maintenance/Administration of Active Directory, Exchange & VOIP System.
Day to day technical support as required
Maintenance of IT asset inventory inclusive of licensing
Tendering, ordering and provisioning equipment
Liaising with external support providers 
Write-up of procedural documents
Project management

work.name: Brandon Trust
work.summary:
Deployment and repair of hardware
Maintenance of file structure and active directory
Updates to Intranet
Support for Information Systems 
Maintain IT Inventory
Maintenance of machines (AV and Windows Updates etc)
Phone system support
Heavy usage of Active Directory

work.name: Merganser Consulting PLC
work.summary:
Proposing, implementing and maintaining a small office network
First point of contact for all user issues
Troubleshooting remotely and on site as required
Write and implement IT and data security policies as required.

work.name: Steria Ltd
work.summary:
First point of contact for all user issues
Remote diagnosis and resolution of software, hardware and networking issues
Working in a high security environment to strict procedures
Keeping users informed of call progress
Escalate calls as necessary
SC Cleared
ITIL Aware

work.name: Alderley Plc
work.summary:
First point of contact for all user issues
Escalating calls to relevant support specialists
Resolving users issues remotely, including abroad
Creating helpdesk procedures
Ordering and delivering of IT orders
Day to day use of MS Office packages

work.name: TLT
work.summary:
Day to day administration of a large network using Microsoft Exchange Server including installation and support of new software. 
Frequent daily use of MS Office packages
Helping users to resolve issues with various IT equipment, both remotely and in person
Creating backups daily and monthly
Working under pressure and having to use own initiative to solve problems
Dealing with suppliers 
High amount of technical knowledge of PCs and IT equipment as well as software knowledge

volunteer.summary: Administration of the Football Club as well organise bookings for social events and training. Often the first point of contact by external agencies who wish to liaise with our club and frequently required dealing with the local Football Federation.

education.institution: University of the West of England

references.name: Nicholas Townsend
references.reference: Peter is a hard working, passionate team player who is very focused on his job. Peter is always happy to lend a hand in order to complete a piece of work. Peter will happily perform an requests in order to benefit the team and has a wide range of useful skills ranging from Windows to Mac OS. He is a valuable member of any IT Support team.

references.name: Gerry Hall
references.reference:
Peter has a very strong ability to inspire confidence in those around him. He combines an extremely impressive breadth of knowledge of all aspects of IT with a relaxed and friendly approach to those he deals with. He is very popular throughout the organisation with his ’no panic’ approach to issues which are then dealt with promptly and efficiently.

Working closely with Peter for the last few years have demonstrated his ability to join technical discussions at all levels and contribute sound ideas. Peter is able to embed his technical skills within a clear understanding of best practice policy and ITIL compliance. The result is being able to contribute effectively to the needs of the organisation.

Linking all this are his communication skills which allow him to gain the trust and respect of customers, managers and contractors. He demonstrates good ability to see the others point of view and narrow in on a solution to the problem at hand. I hope to work with Peter again in the future and would have him on my team in an instant.

references.name: Charles Price
references.reference: Peter was always a willing and technically competent support engineer who provided a good server to my business in Russia using our remote management systems.
